meanings.definition: Able to be distinguished or recognized
meanings.sent1: The different colors of the flowers were discriminable even from far away.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's handwriting was so clear that every letter was discriminable.
meanings.sent3: The discriminable shapes in the clouds made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her discriminable talent for painting shone brighter than the sun.
meanings.sent5: The discriminable sound of the bell signaled the end of the school day.

meanings.sent1: The discriminable patterns on the butterfly's wings amazed the observers.
meanings.sent2: The flavors of the ice cream were so discriminable that each one stood out.
meanings.sent3: The discriminable tastes in the soup made it a unique culinary experience.
meanings.sent4: His discriminable skills in math set him apart from his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The discriminable scents of the flowers filled the garden with fragrance.
